result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Timely filed

Information was E-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defendant waived reading of Information; Defendant stood mute, Court enters plea of Not Guilty; motions due in 20 days; bail continued.

Branch 2 - SOJ timely filed.

Defendant in court with Attorney Devonte Windham for Schuyler S Boggio.  Colleen Lennon appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State recommends cts 1 and 2 be found transactionally related. No objection. Cts so finds. Officer H.R. duly sworn and testified. Direct by State. Venue established. DE identified. Cross. State moves for b/o, waives argument, reserves rebuttal. DE objects to b/o, argument. Ct finds PC felony was committed probably by DE. DE signed up for text message reminders.
